description: Enterprise techniques used by SQLRat, ATT&CK software S0390 (v1.2)
name: SQLRat (S0390)

techniques.comment: [SQLRat](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0390) has used PowerShell to create a Meterpreter session.(Citation: Flashpoint FIN 7 March 2019)
[SQLRat](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0390) has used SQL to execute JavaScript and VB scripts on the host system.(Citation: Flashpoint FIN 7 March 2019)
[SQLRat](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0390) has scripts that are responsible for deobfuscating additional scripts.(Citation: Flashpoint FIN 7 March 2019)
[SQLRat](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0390) has used been observed deleting scripts once used.(Citation: Flashpoint FIN 7 March 2019)

[SQLRat](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0390) can make a direct SQL connection to a Microsoft database controlled by the attackers, retrieve an item from the bindata table, then write and execute the file on disk.(Citation: Flashpoint FIN 7 March 2019)
[SQLRat](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0390) has used a character insertion obfuscation technique, making the script appear to contain Chinese characters.(Citation: Flashpoint FIN 7 March 2019)
[SQLRat](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0390) has created scheduled tasks in %appdata%\Roaming\Microsoft\Templates\.(Citation: Flashpoint FIN 7 March 2019)
[SQLRat](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0390) relies on users clicking on an embedded image to execute the scripts.(Citation: Flashpoint FIN 7 March 2019)
